Job Title: Financial Planning and Analysis Manager

Location: Nashville Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Finance

Description:
Financial Planning and Analysis ManagerThe Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Manager is responsible for providing management with an analysis and insight of Guardian’s financial results in coordination with the broader accounting team. The overall objective is to contribute to directional strategy as well as utilize in-depth specialty knowledge to provide advice and counsel on the evaluation of financial reports of Guardian’s current and projected performance.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:Create financial reports to clearly summarize financial trends and provide insight to senior managementAdvise on directional strategy and provide guidance on significant business and product decisionsCollaboratively evaluate opportunities for business growth and cost controlLead the FP&A efforts on both integration and process improvement projects, in close collaboration with CFO and ControllerDevelop annual budgets and mid-year reforecasts in partnership with CFO. Layer in forecasts for acquired companiesPrepare analytics in support of CEO Reviews, including business initiativesExecute analysis of product profitability and provide guidance on significant business and product decisionsConduct advanced financial analysis including but not limited to income statement, balance sheet, cashflow statement, and capital investment analysisPartner with Senior LeadershipDevelop Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) / drivers and measure performance to established metrics.Prioritize initiatives, perform special projects, and ad-hoc financial reporting as requiredPrepare presentations and analysis m supporting the CFOOperate with a limited level of direct supervisionExercise independence of judgement and autonomyPartner with Accounting to review and assist in month end close processOther job-related duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS:3+ years of relevant financial planning experience with minimum of 2 years of experience in Private Equity (PE) backed organizationExperience with construction industry financial reviews with the ability to perform variance analysis is highly preferredExpert Excel User and proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications and overall computer skills. 1+ years using business intelligence tools (e.g., PowerBI)Previous experience demonstrating presentation skills at Board levelConsistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organizationAs a condition of employment, employer will conduct a background check and drug screen prior to hireAbility to understand, speak, and write English EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATIONS:BA/BS in Business, Finance, or other related disciplineMBA, CFA, or CPA preferred
 BENEFITSMedical/Dental/Vision insurance offeredPTO and Holiday pay provided + weekly payrollEmployee Recognition Programs
 ADDITIONAL INFORMATIONCompensation Range: salary is based on experience and locationPosition Hours: fulltime hours, typically 40/week
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position.
